ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have felt moments of sudden terror, fear, or fright
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have felt anxious, worried, or nervous
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have had thoughts of bad things happening, such as family tragedy, ill health, loss of a job or accidents
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have felt a racing heart, sweaty, trouble breathing, faint, or shaky
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have felt tense muscles, felt on edge or restless or had trouble relaxing or trouble sleeping
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have avoided, or did not approach or enter, situations about which I worry
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have left sitautions early or participated only minimally due to worries
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have spent lots of time making decisions, putting off making decisions, or preparing for situations, due to worries
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have sought reassurance from others due to worries
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: Generalized Anxiety: I have needed help to cope with anxiety (e.g., alcohol or medication, superstitious objects, or other people)
Notes: 0 = never; 1=occasionally; 2=half of the time; 3=most of the time; 4=all of the time

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Feeling down, depressed or hopeless
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Feeling tired or having little energy
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Poor appetite or overeating
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Moving or speaking so slowly so that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

ElementDescription: How often have you been bothered by: Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
Notes: 0 = never; 1=several days; 2=more than half the days; 3=nearly every day

How anxious, nervous or fearful do you usually get when you are in a social situation, like attending a party or meeting new people?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= A little; 2= Some; 3= A lot; 4= Extremely

ElementDescription: How anxious, nervous or fearful do you usually get when you are the center of attention, like speaking up in class or at a meeting, giving a presentation in class, or talking to people in authority?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= A little; 2= Some; 3= A lot; 4= Extremely

ElementDescription: How often do you get very anxious, nervous or fearful when you are the center of attention? /  How often do you get very anxious, nervous or fearful when you are in social situations or in situations where you are the center of attention?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3=Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: How often do you try to avoid situations where you are the center of attention? / How often do you try to avoid social situations or situations where you are the center of attention?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3=Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: How much does your anxiety or fear of these situations interfere with your activities at home, work, school, or in your social life? / How much does your anxiety, fear, or avoidance of these situations interfere with your activities at home, work, school, or in your social life?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3=Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: Specify the timeframe (in the past year, past two weeks, etc.) in which elements/items are assessed
